TITLE: Implementing React Email Editor Component DESCRIPTION: Example of how to use the EmailEditor component in a React application. It demonstrates importing the component, setting up a ref, handling the onReady event, and exporting HTML. SOURCE: https://github.com/unlayer/react-email-editor/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` import React, { useRef } from 'react'; import { render } from 'react-dom'; import EmailEditor, { EditorRef, EmailEditorProps } from 'react-email-editor'; const App = (props) => { const emailEditorRef = useRef(null); const exportHtml = () => { const unlayer = emailEditorRef.current?.editor; unlayer?.exportHtml((data) => { const { design, html } = data; console.log('exportHtml', html); }); }; const onReady: EmailEditorProps['onReady'] = (unlayer) => { // editor is ready // you can load your template here; // the design json can be obtained by calling // unlayer.loadDesign(callback) or unlayer.exportHtml(callback) // const templateJson = { DESIGN JSON GOES HERE }; // unlayer.loadDesign(templateJson); }; return (
); }; render(, document.getElementById('app')); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing React Email Editor via NPM DESCRIPTION: Command to install the React Email Editor package using NPM. SOURCE: https://github.com/unlayer/react-email-editor/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` npm install react-email-editor --save ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing Dependencies for React Email Editor DESCRIPTION: Command for installing all dependencies needed for component development in the project's root directory. SOURCE: https://github.com/unlayer/react-email-editor/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` npm install ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Building the Component for Publishing DESCRIPTION: Command to build the React Email Editor component for publishing to npm registry. SOURCE: https://github.com/unlayer/react-email-editor/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-21_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` npm run build ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Starting the Demo Development Server DESCRIPTION: Command for running the component's demo application locally with hot module reloading at http://localhost:3000. SOURCE: https://github.com/unlayer/react-email-editor/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` npm start ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing Dependencies for Demo Application DESCRIPTION: Command for installing all dependencies needed to run the demo application locally. SOURCE: https://github.com/unlayer/react-email-editor/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` npm install ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Building the Demo Application DESCRIPTION: Command to build the demo application for production deployment. SOURCE: https://github.com/unlayer/react-email-editor/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-21_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` npm run build ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running Tests with Coverage Report DESCRIPTION: Command to run the tests and generate a code coverage report in the coverage/ directory. SOURCE: https://github.com/unlayer/react-email-editor/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-21_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` npm run test:coverage ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running Tests Once DESCRIPTION: Command to run the test suite once to verify the component's functionality. SOURCE: https://github.com/unlayer/react-email-editor/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-21_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` npm test ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running Tests in Watch Mode DESCRIPTION: Command to run tests in watch mode, which will re-run tests automatically when code changes are detected. SOURCE: https://github.com/unlayer/react-email-editor/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-21_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` npm run test:watch ```
